result.execSummary:
The defendant Jay A Peterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber with standard release conditions.  Sentence credit for 4 days was granted if revoked.
Probation may be transferred to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes: Costs and DNA Surcharge to be paid as a condition of probation.

No use or possession of alcohol or illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Advise any treating physicians of drug use or history before being prescribed any medications.  Ingest any of these medications only in the manner prescribed.

Defendant to avoid any person or place associated with the sale, distribution, or use of illegal controlled substances.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jay A Peterson

defendant.name: Peterson, Jay A

records.addlTxt:
Notice of Case Status Change. Terminated - regular
  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been set to balance due. Under judgment minimum.
Character letters (2) in support of defendant, filed by defense counsel Dvorak 12/18/17.

Defendant Jay A Peterson in court with attorney Robert J. Dvorak. Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court recesses at 9:40am to allow the State to file an amended charging document. Court re-calls case at 9:51 am. State provides the Court and defense with an Amended Information. Defense does not object to the filing of the Amended Information. Defendant pleads guilty to Count # 1. Court finds defendant guilty of Count # 1. Count # 2 was previously dismissed and read-in. State makes recommendations. Attorney Dvorak makes statements. Defendant makes statements. 

The Court Orders the Following:

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:

6 months Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS. Stayed. (Credit - 4 days, if revoked).

Term of Probation: 1 Year

Probation may be transferred to Milwaukee County.

Conditions of Probation:

-Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;

-No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia;

-Inform agent of all prescriptions;

-Defendant to avoid any person or place associated with the sale, distribution, or use of illegal controlled substances

-Advise any treating physicians of drug use history before being prescribed any medications. Ingest any of these medications only in the manner prescribed.  

COSTS:  $243.00 to be paid as a condition of probation

DNA Surcharge: $200.00 to be paid as a condition of probation

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Letter in support of defendant from Lauren Lathers, Roots Counseling Services, filed by defense counsel Dvorak on 12/15/17.
Letter in support of defendant from James Alder, Roots Counseling Services, filed by defense counsel Dvorak on 12/15/17.
Sentencing hearing on December 18, 2017 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Jay A Peterson in court.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement made by the defendant.  Defendant has graduated from DTC.  Diversion Agreement is fulfilled. File to be forwarded to Judge Ramirez for sentencing.

Defendant Jay A Peterson in court with attorney Robert J. Dvorak.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1. Court accepts plea as, knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily made. Court withholds entry of judgment as the defendant has been accepted into DTC. Court approves the Waukesha County DTC Diversion Contract and forwards the file to DTC.  Count #2 is dismissed and read in.
